title: U.S. disposable personal income - monthly percentage of change 2019/20
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.
The Monthly percentage of change is appeared to be the highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
The difference of Monthly percentage of change between the highest and lowest Month is 0.6.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Monthly percentage of change in the y axis.
The Monthly percentage of change is highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.
The Monthly percentage of change is appeared to be the highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
The difference of Monthly percentage of change between the highest and lowest Month is 0.6.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Monthly percentage of change in the y axis.
The Monthly percentage of change is highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
Second maximum Monthly percentage of change is found at Month Aug '19.
The difference of Monthly percentage of change between the highest and lowest Month is 0.6.
Monthly percentage of change at Month Jan '20 is 0.6 , second place is Aug '19 at 0.6, and thirdly is Feb '19 at 0.5.
The Monthly percentage of change has decreased over the past 13 Months.
Month Nov '19, Jun '19, Apr '19, and Mar '19 share the same value 0.4.
Considered together, the average Monthly percentage of change in all 13 Months is roughly 0.35.
Summing up the values of all Months, we get total 4.5.
